page.title: 16HAILES WOOD 2 MANAGEMENT
page.content: Coppicing may have developed over 4000 years ago but didn't become widespread until the Norman conquest.There is evidence of lime & hazel coppice.In medieval times the monks from the Abbey maintained this method of management.They probably replanted the original sessile oaks with penduculate oak standards.The demand for coppiced wood declined after 1900.The wood is now actively managed for timber and as a game covert. Sections of the wood have been replanted;there are stands of larch,poplar,norway spruce and cherry.Ornamental species such as cherry laurel and northern red oak have also been planted. The wood has a very rich assemblage of shrubs and trees.
